about_the_game:
iCorp is a tycoon game where you establish and manage your own company. Manufacture any product from the hundreds available in the game, build factories, set up production processes, buy and upgrade machinery, and take control over everything related to large company operations.



Build your factories from the ground up using a powerful, yet intuitive, modular system. Design the lighting and ventilation and placement of furnishings to increase employee satisfaction.



Buy, upgrade, and maintain production machinery to maximize the speed and efficiency of production processes. Observe even the most minute detail of each machine, its movement and what its job entails.



Buy material, manage production and make sure that everything works as efficiently as possible. Whenever a machine is idle, you lose money!

Satisfied staff work faster and are more efficient. Think about this when paying wages and building a functional working environment. You don't want your employees to go on strike, do you?



Have you manufactured any of the hundreds of products available? Now is the time to sell them! This game offers the simulation of global markets with ever-changing demands and many tough opponents who will stop at nothing to push their competitors out of the market.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Dual Core 2.5 GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1060 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Quad Core 3.5 GHz
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce RTX 2060 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 4 GB available space

short_description: Build, equip, manage and sell! Those are the four cornerstones of this tycoon game. Produce anything from wooden cutlery to modern electronics to rockets. Build factories, setup production processes, buy and upgrade machinery, and take order over everything related to large company operations.
